lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Stan_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/stan/Stan.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run stan.Stan.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
options.encoding = 'UTF-8'  // Ensure UTF-8 encoding for compilation
systemProperty "file.encoding", "UTF-8"  // Ensure UTF-8 encoding for tests
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Enum representing the different types of commands that the Stan chatbot can handle.
* Each command corresponds to a specific action the user can perform.

*
  • LIST: Displays all tasks in the task list.

*
  • UNMARK: Unmarks a task as not done.

*
  • DELETE: Deletes a task from the task list.

*
  • FIND: Searches for tasks that match a keyword.
BYE, LIST, TODO, EVENT, DEADLINE, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, FIND
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* The main class that launches the JavaFX application for Stan.
private final Stan stan = new Stan("data/stan.txt");
stage.setMinHeight(600); // Minimum height for the window
stage.setMinWidth(400); // Minimum width for the window

* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("Index is out of bounds");
* Gets a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to get.
* @return The task at the specified index.
// Assert that index is within valid range
assert index >= 0 && index < tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
* Returns the size of the task list.

* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* All specific command types should extend this class.
* @param tasks The task list where tasks are managed.
* @param ui The UI object to interact with the user.
* @param storage The storage object to save or load tasks.
* @throws StanException If an error occurs during command execution.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws StanException;
* Indicates whether the command is an exit command.
* @return true if the command is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to add a deadline task.
* @param words The user input split into words.
* @throws StanMissingArgumentException If the description or '/by' clause is missing.
* @throws StanInvalidArgumentException If the description or time is empty, or if '/by' clause is missing.
public DeadlineCommand(String[] words) throws StanMissingArgumentException, StanInvalidArgumentException {
throw new StanMissingArgumentException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new StanInvalidArgumentException("The deadline description is present but the '/by' "
+ "clause is missing. Please add the '/by' clause followed by the time.");
throw new StanInvalidArgumentException("The deadline description and time cannot be empty.");

public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws StanInvalidDateTimeFormatException {

* Represents a command to add an event task.
* @param words The user input split into words.

* @throws StanInvalidArgumentException If the description, start time, or end time is empty.
public EventCommand(String[] words) throws StanMissingArgumentException, StanInvalidArgumentException {
throw new StanMissingArgumentException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new StanInvalidArgumentException("The event description is present but the '/from' or '/to' "
+ "clause is missing. Please add the '/from' clause followed by the start time and "
+ "the '/to' clause followed by the end time.");
throw new StanInvalidArgumentException("The event description cannot be empty.");
throw new StanInvalidArgumentException("The event start time and end time cannot be empty.");

* Represents a general exception used in the Stan application.
* Constructs a StanException with the specified detail message.

* Represents an exception thrown when an invalid command is entered by the user.
* Constructs a StanInvalidCommandException with a default detail message.

* @throws StanInvalidDateTimeFormatException If the date and time format is incorrect.

* Returns a message indicating that a task has been added.

* @param taskCount The current number of tasks in the list.

* Returns a message indicating that a task has been deleted.

* @param taskCount The current number of tasks in the list.
public String showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {
+ "Now you have " + taskCount + " tasks left. Clean and tidy! ";
* Returns a message indicating that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.

return " Awesome! I've marked this task as done! \n" + "   " + task + "\n"
+ "You're on a roll with " + taskCount + " tasks left! Keep going! ";
* Returns a message indicating that a task has been unmarked as not done.

+ "You have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list. Let's get it done! ";

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@../css/main.css" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/17.0.2-ea" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="stan.ui.MainWindow">
<!-- Anchor TextField to the bottom and ensure it resizes horizontally -->
<TextField fx:id="userInput" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="76.0" />
<!-- Anchor Send Button to the bottom-right corner -->
<Button fx:id="sendButton" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" />
<!-- Anchor ScrollPane to resize both horizontally and vertically -->

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" vbarPolicy="ALWAYS" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="43.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="0.0">

* Unit tests for the TaskList class.
* This class tests various operations on the TaskList, such as adding, retrieving tasks, and verifying list size.
* Sets up a new TaskList before each test.
* This method is executed before every individual test case.
* Tests the behavior of adding a task to the TaskList.
* Ensures that the task is correctly added and the size of the list increases.
* Tests the behavior of removing a task from the TaskList.
* Ensures that the correct task is removed and the size of the list decreases.
* Tests the behavior of retrieving a task from the TaskList.
* Ensures that the correct task is retrieved by its index.
* Tests the behavior of checking the size of the TaskList.
* Ensures that the size reflects the number of tasks correctly.
* Tests the behavior of removing a task with an invalid index from the TaskList.
* Ensures that an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown and the size of the list remains unchanged.
taskList.remove(2); // This should throw an IndexOutOfBoundsException
assertEquals(2, taskList.size()); // Ensure size has not changed
* Tests the behavior of finding tasks with a matching keyword in the TaskList.
Task task1 = new MockTask("Read a book");
Task task2 = new MockTask("Write an essay");
* Tests the behavior of finding tasks with no matching keyword in the TaskList.
Task task1 = new MockTask("Read a book");
Task task2 = new MockTask("Write an essay");
* Tests the behavior of finding multiple tasks with the same keyword in the TaskList.
Task task1 = new MockTask("Read a book");
Task task2 = new MockTask("Write a book report");
